p.s: The informative and non-fictional text Hope of escape lost in translation, written by Zia Haider Rahman from the Sunday Times, 17th December 2016 with 344 words is about learning language and its consequences for the integration of immigrant communities in GBGreat Britain.
The author has the opinion, that we should think about making English compulsory for all citizens.
He also says that learning languages can broaden your horizons and give you better memory.
Just because English is a foreign language we have to celebrate our diversity and getting us all to speak English so that we can communicate anywhere with people around the world.
Besides these arguments for learning language there are also consequences for the integration of immigrant communities in GBGreat Britain.
First, the financial cost is bad enough and yearly a lot of money is spent on translating and interpreting for residents who who don't speak English or don't have English as their mother tongue.
The immigrant communities get alone integrate and because of this every year Bangladeshis sit at the bottom of educational achievement and don't know how their lives will go on.
So the crime and drug abuse rise fast in the East End.
At the end the author believebelieves we should curb the translation and interpreting services, get involved for people who don't speak English and protect the educational achievement in Bangladesh.
